answerText: Florence[10] Another troublesome dwarf is this main character in The Tin Drum, who shatters glass with his voice to avoid going to school, and joins a gang after Roswitha is killed.
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Alabama + Georgia Tech+ WUStL | 15 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Much like Kirun Sankaran's attic, European literature is rife with conniving dwarves. For 10 points each: [10] The title character of PÃ¤r Lagerkvist's The Dwarf poisons the prince's rivals and flogs his wife while employed by a court resembling that of this city. It is the departure site of the journey taken in The Decameron.
